commit_message:
Add necessary parameters for encrypted volumes support

If barbican is set, it will configure cinder and nova-compute with
the necessary parameters to enable encrypted volumes to be created if
requested.

Change-Id: Id13811cf8e090706c590ffff46c237ff8131efd9

commit_message:
Fix cluster progress calculation if Astute didn't send it

Deploying status has been removed, we assume that the node is
int deploying status if status is provisioned or ready, and
progress is greater than zero.

Change-Id: Ia64b5c9e54591892685f1e1806124f2523bcb40b
(cherry picked from commit 3ed600aa3e6b67130da4d1dd8952a9d36bc1a849)
(cherry picked from commit 2690a66ae60e632da22d13175aecd310498e316d)

commit_message:
Introduce tags_metadata file for plugins

'tags_metadata.yaml' file contains set of tags for tasks
serialization. These tags can be used in roles introduced
by the plugin.

(cherry picked from commit e8ed5cba839beb9c93b6259332848db75e9d4efc)
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
Change-Id: I1e68a240b2fe535188404eb47c23b875a4616f2a

commit_message:
Revert "Update devstack keystone_authtoken config to fit with keystone v3"

This reverts commit df8bf9c8f85fb1c1aa27c803a78868f54a42e1ea.
That patch renamed keys of the configuration properties of the
keystone_authtoken settings group, thus breaking config file
compatibility.

Change-Id: I8fd3b3211e75207cf6061eef6f038ea045d9dbfe

subject: Remove skipException for volume creation failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 00:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_list.py'], 'message': "Remove skipException for volume creation failure

Since Ice367b73303d74c529351d7bd4d9a4e9b1348e07 , the check has been
added when nova-volume(not cinder) was enabled. At the time, we didn't
have enough resources on the gate and made the resource creation
failure as skip.
However that skip might hide configration issues and we have removed
the similar skip code on Ib82fabb1684ee6beaac2a7c45b0b2dc8ec5d6b4c.
There is still the same skip code in Tempest, and this patch removes
it.

Change-Id: Ib1e851a6380b694f7bdaefdf098d73f791111f6d
Closes-Bug: #1401290
"}]
commit_message:
Remove skipException for volume creation failure

Since Ice367b73303d74c529351d7bd4d9a4e9b1348e07 , the check has been
added when nova-volume(not cinder) was enabled. At the time, we didn't
have enough resources on the gate and made the resource creation
failure as skip.
However that skip might hide configration issues and we have removed
the similar skip code on Ib82fabb1684ee6beaac2a7c45b0b2dc8ec5d6b4c.
There is still the same skip code in Tempest, and this patch removes
it.

Change-Id: Ib1e851a6380b694f7bdaefdf098d73f791111f6d
Closes-Bug: #1401290

subject: rest: wait for the  thread pool executor result
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 15:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py'], 'message': "rest: wait for the  thread pool executor result

Currently we return to wsgi server once all threads have been started
and don't wait for their return.

Keeping running threads not attached to a request make some wsgi server
mad. And also returning 202 when it should 500 doesn't help to debug
application.

Change-Id: I922e0b7d61280ac42b1068afdcafe68fd5835ba8
"}]
commit_message:
rest: wait for the  thread pool executor result

Currently we return to wsgi server once all threads have been started
and don't wait for their return.

Keeping running threads not attached to a request make some wsgi server
mad. And also returning 202 when it should 500 doesn't help to debug
application.

Change-Id: I922e0b7d61280ac42b1068afdcafe68fd5835ba8

subject: Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 15:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_deployment.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/deployment.py', 'tripleo_common/constants.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/passwords.py'], 'message': 'Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7
(cherry picked from commit e1c07fc453e5113782fb0d22cd4a487260f68579)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7
(cherry picked from commit e1c07fc453e5113782fb0d22cd4a487260f68579)

that don't warrant a bug.

Update the docs to reflect this.

commit_message:
Use kwargs to pass in data and error to Mistral Result

This standardises how we create mistral.workflow.utils.Result instances.
Previously we used a combination of passing empty strings or None values
to pass errors only. Using kwargs makes this clearer and cleaner. This
is also means we use the Result class in the same way as the builtin
Mistral actions.

Change-Id: Ic94c0513b1fba030de70263ac1df32b4ab130e9a

commit_message:
Add tags support in CLI

Releases new fuel2 commands to operate on tags:
fuel2 tag create
fuel2 tag delete
fuel2 tag download
fuel2 tag list
fuel2 tag update

DocImpact

Change-Id: I71ae78b4a733d83a5441ff0ac5ba627502e7f2b3
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 21:02:37.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute-role.yaml', 'puppet/cephstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/objectstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/role.role.j2.yaml', 'puppet/blockstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/controller-role.yaml'], 'message': 'Make the CloudDomain defaults match the doc strings

Not having the default easily accessible is causing issues for the UI,
as it cannot guess at it and can accidentally overwrite the value with
an empty string (the expected default when unset). The default is
already helpfully spelled out in the doc string for each file, this
updates the parameter to match it.

Change-Id: Ic284f9904e8f1d01cc717d59a0759f679d94106d
Closes-Bug: #1643670
'}]
commit_message:
Make the CloudDomain defaults match the doc strings

Not having the default easily accessible is causing issues for the UI,
as it cannot guess at it and can accidentally overwrite the value with
an empty string (the expected default when unset). The default is
already helpfully spelled out in the doc string for each file, this
updates the parameter to match it.

Change-Id: Ic284f9904e8f1d01cc717d59a0759f679d94106d
Closes-Bug: #1643670

dsvm-functional test fails to run due to lack of setfacl command.
Install acl package that includes setfacl, and set GATE_STACK_USER
which configure_for_func_testing.sh requires.

Change-Id: I4582dae53c660598c1a304f4bd467250431407a1
'}]
commit_message:
functional test: install acl package

dsvm-functional test fails to run due to lack of setfacl command.
Install acl package that includes setfacl, and set GATE_STACK_USER
which configure_for_func_testing.sh requires.

commit_message:
Start using tripleo-quickstart-extras

Replace the extra role requirements from
quickstart-extras-requirements.txt with a single repository upstream
(tripleo-quickstart-extras) consisting of the merged history of all
previously used roles.

Further changes to these roles are to be submitted to this
tripleo-quickstart-extras repo through review.openstack.org instead of
review.gerrithub.io.

Several role name changes occured during this transition, which this
change also corrects in playbooks hosted within this repository.

Change-Id: I9b532b8f63d68d9791f7403c9d66558f8221d980

commit_message:
Run amphora agent with gunicorn

Flask's default runner (werkzeug) is plagued with bugs.
If we use gunicorn instead, we should have many less problems!

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 13:46:11.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

Change-Id: I43e1ec46bf145ebcf23d044c7a6f08f2b60542d9
Partial-bug: #1642377
"}]
commit_message:
Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

Change-Id: I43e1ec46bf145ebcf23d044c7a6f08f2b60542d9
Partial-bug: #1642377

subject: Glance upgrade testing.
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test-install-previous-glance.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Glance upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_glance role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of glance, and the test-vars from the stable/newton branch to be used by
the previous version of glance.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

Change-Id: I8b2418ffc9197814b0eb85da647916323f9cefd5
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
"}]
commit_message:
Glance upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_glance role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of glance, and the test-vars from the stable/newton branch to be used by
the previous version of glance.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

Change-Id: I8b2418ffc9197814b0eb85da647916323f9cefd5
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing

commit_message:
Remove join filter from optional pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I16d6d75cc432ba57407689d0e1a4055c8172ce12

commit_message:
devstack: run tests with tempest run command

tempest/tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh is deprecated way and caused test
failure due to version mismatch.
So use tempest run command with tox to run tests.

Change-Id: If896118452e11401723efdab23f044b3e85476ab
Related-bug: #1634940
(cherry picked from commit c0f6114e6d91d6a4ea56c9a3d34fb7be01b400f7)

commit_message:
Add API for listing all introspection statuses

This patch introduces an API endpoint to list introspection statuses.  The
endpoint supports pagination with an uuid-marker and a limit query string
fields.  Due to the pagination, this change introduces a new configuration
option: ``api_max_limit``.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I74d02698801d5290619161b2d8d7181ab51a0a5e
Partial-Bug: #1525238

Remove the nova_fs alarms

We don't know if there is a dedicated filesystem for /var/lib/nova so we
cannot have alarms for this filesystem.

Change-Id: I3d7f7db02c7a6e1f4228e56ade94da5e88a2681e

subject: Set heat.conf max_nested_stack_depth = 6
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-21 02:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Set heat.conf max_nested_stack_depth = 6

The undercloud currently relies on the default
max_nested_stack_depth=5. However the containerised compute change[1]
adds another level of nested stacks. This means that container
developers are manually setting max_nested_stack_depth=6 to deploy a
containerised overcloud.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330659

Change-Id: Ie6dcce9c332c06e2acb889358e08746aec593319
Depends-On: I998f3a1a89ce4bc4c3926a83adec1929addeab24
'}]
commit_message:
Set heat.conf max_nested_stack_depth = 6

The undercloud currently relies on the default
max_nested_stack_depth=5. However the containerised compute change[1]
adds another level of nested stacks. This means that container
developers are manually setting max_nested_stack_depth=6 to deploy a
containerised overcloud.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330659

Change-Id: Ie6dcce9c332c06e2acb889358e08746aec593319
Depends-On: I998f3a1a89ce4bc4c3926a83adec1929addeab24

commit_message:
Introduce tags_metadata file for plugins

'tags_metadata.yaml' file contains set of tags for tasks
serialization. These tags can be used in roles introduced
by the plugin.

Change-Id: I1e68a240b2fe535188404eb47c23b875a4616f2a
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin compatibility

The devstack mistral compatibility was broken by a recent patch in
devstack. This patch is intended to fix the issue by removing the
dependency on deleted env variables.

Change-Id: I768168fa95f5bc010815af5ff03117edb245137b
Closes-Bug: #1644194

commit_message:
Enable hacking extensions framework

<long rant deleted>

This change enables the hacking extensions ability in trove. That
includes bumping the version of hacking that we use, and also adding
the enable-extensions like in the [flake8] section. I've enabled two
of the hacking extensions here.

There are some limitations to the hacking rules that I've enabled so
I'm also going to enter two bugs that others can fix (if they so
desire).

Change-Id: I6d8fc4bc03f948b84ad823e5248d78a4caa5c042
Related-Bug: 1642554
Related-Bug: 1642552

subject: Avoid redundant validations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 20:52:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Avoid redundant validations

When multiple resources in a stack have identical definitions, there is no
purpose in re-running validation on every single one. This is a common
occurrence in, for example, autoscaling groups.

By eliminating the need to validate every identical resource, this patch
should help prevent timeouts on create/update with large autoscaling groups
of the kind created by e.g. Magnum.

Change-Id: Iaed5a707a72ae558552d35738db10dc05e5f6343
Closes-Bug: #1644013
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundant validations

When multiple resources in a stack have identical definitions, there is no
purpose in re-running validation on every single one. This is a common
occurrence in, for example, autoscaling groups.

By eliminating the need to validate every identical resource, this patch
should help prevent timeouts on create/update with large autoscaling groups
of the kind created by e.g. Magnum.

Change-Id: Iaed5a707a72ae558552d35738db10dc05e5f6343
Closes-Bug: #1644013

intended for testing purposes and not for production use. Individual

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-11-01 14:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/num_instances_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py', 'nova/scheduler/weights/affinity.py'], 'message': 'conf: Attempt to resolve TODOs in scheduler.py

There are five options marked with TODOs:

* periodic_task_interval - negative values are valid, making the TODO
  invalid
* host_subset_size - code was in-place to prevent negative values, so
  replace this code with a min parameter
* isolated_images - removing this option requires a little bit of
  thought and would likely require a blueprint. Retain this for now.
* max_instances_per_host, attestation_auth_timeout,
  soft_affinity_weight_multiplier,
  soft_anti_affinity_weight_multiplier - support funky value ranges
  which, semantically speaking, shouldn't be allowed.  Start logging
  any "invalid" values.

Change-Id: I8871b628f0ab892830ceeede68db16948cb293c8
'}]
commit_message:
conf: Attempt to resolve TODOs in scheduler.py

There are five options marked with TODOs:

* periodic_task_interval - negative values are valid, making the TODO
  invalid
* host_subset_size - code was in-place to prevent negative values, so
  replace this code with a min parameter
* isolated_images - removing this option requires a little bit of
  thought and would likely require a blueprint. Retain this for now.
* max_instances_per_host, attestation_auth_timeout,
  soft_affinity_weight_multiplier,
  soft_anti_affinity_weight_multiplier - support funky value ranges
  which, semantically speaking, shouldn't be allowed.  Start logging
  any "invalid" values.

Change-Id: I8871b628f0ab892830ceeede68db16948cb293c8

commit_message:
Move wait_for_interface_status to waiters

This is to move wait_for_interface_status to waiters so it can
be used elsewhere. Besides, wait_for_interface_status returns
the detail of show_interface which is needed in testcases.

Change-Id: I3a8cee9cd344be295cb0cdef5930793403cc6bca

commit_message:
Check volume and minimum disk sizes to create volume

Check minimum disk size before attempting to create a volume
from an image. Use the maximum between that value and the volume
size specified in the configuration.

Change-Id: I8e540de90b308877575816edb8305588b1fe6e17

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-17 14:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/keystone.yaml'], 'message': 'Configure Keystone Fernet Keys

Provision the Keystone Fernet Token provider
by installing 2 keys with dynamic content
generated by python-tripleoclient.

Note that this only sets up the necessary keys to use fernet as a token
provider, however, this does not intend to set it up as the default
provider; This will be discussed and will come as part of another
commit.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iaa5499614417000c1b9ba42a776a50cb22c1bb30
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Keystone Fernet Keys

Provision the Keystone Fernet Token provider
by installing 2 keys with dynamic content
generated by python-tripleoclient.

Note that this only sets up the necessary keys to use fernet as a token
provider, however, this does not intend to set it up as the default
provider; This will be discussed and will come as part of another
commit.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ic070d160b519b8637997dbde165dbf15275e0dfe
Change-Id: Iaa5499614417000c1b9ba42a776a50cb22c1bb30

commit_message:
Add subgraph execution support

Add -S option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e
Closes-bug: 1612616

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 14:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/debug.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I33ae2f79d3db240e053aa0e6938404969826efaf
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I33ae2f79d3db240e053aa0e6938404969826efaf

commit_message:
Add migrations for NICs and Bonds 'interface_properties'

* Add default bond_attributes and nic_attributes for upgrade 'releases' table
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for NICs from 'interface_properties'
  into 'attributes' and 'meta' fields and contrary.
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for Bonds from 'interface_properties'
  and 'bond_properties' fields into 'attributes' field and contrary.

Change-Id: Ib1b1ad55372fa1e7e67a51273ce237acb61a7201
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

subject: Fix Cinder multinode grenade job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 15:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Cinder multinode grenade job

JJB treats lists differently than single values in `node` properties.
This was causing no worker being registered for the Cinder multinode
grenade jobs. This commit switches from list notation in `node`
properties for gate-grenade-dsvm-cinder-multinode-* jobs.

Change-Id: I0382470bb666cbf7ed64e1427259dd96f1b06b5e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Cinder multinode grenade job

JJB treats lists differently than single values in `node` properties.
This was causing no worker being registered for the Cinder multinode
grenade jobs. This commit switches from list notation in `node`
properties for gate-grenade-dsvm-cinder-multinode-* jobs.

Change-Id: I0382470bb666cbf7ed64e1427259dd96f1b06b5e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 21:26:42.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_overcloud_image.py'], 'message': "Remove network-gateway element from image build

This element is for configuring a network gateway. TripleO is not using

uses os-net-config to configure networking settings instead.

Change-Id: I321baa01e25c346a86d36618d519b7204e7dd39f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove network-gateway element from image build

This element is for configuring a network gateway. TripleO is not using
that configuration mechanism (and hasn't for quite some time), as it
uses os-net-config to configure networking settings instead.

Change-Id: I321baa01e25c346a86d36618d519b7204e7dd39f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 11:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_deployment.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/deployment.py', 'tripleo_common/constants.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/passwords.py'], 'message': 'Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7
'}]
commit_message:
Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7

subject: Install yum-plugin-priorities on centos images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 18:38:03.000000000', 'files': ['image-yaml/overcloud-images-centos7.yaml'], 'message': 'Install yum-plugin-priorities on centos images

When installing from dlrn repos on centos, we need to respect the
repo priorities.  This is not needed on rhel, so it is added to the
centos-specific image file only.

Change-Id: Idd083a4bf6f4cf11c8f552c4ff9fea05a3c8b79f
'}]
commit_message:
Install yum-plugin-priorities on centos images

When installing from dlrn repos on centos, we need to respect the
repo priorities.  This is not needed on rhel, so it is added to the
centos-specific image file only.

Change-Id: Idd083a4bf6f4cf11c8f552c4ff9fea05a3c8b79f

subject: Tacker changes to xenial node
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-23 14:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['.idea/vcs.xml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/tacker.yaml'], 'message': 'Tacker changes to xenial node

This patch will help devstack gate job in Tacker move to Xenial node.
Recenltly, several OpenStack projects use new version libraries which
are available  on Xenial. Tacker leverages these projects, therefore
it is necessary to change to Xenial node.

Change-Id: If9eebb0946951d47f8b8dec4996a20fdee0ecd0e
'}]
commit_message:
Tacker changes to xenial node

This patch will help devstack gate job in Tacker move to Xenial node.
Recenltly, several OpenStack projects use new version libraries which
are available  on Xenial. Tacker leverages these projects, therefore
it is necessary to change to Xenial node.

Change-Id: If9eebb0946951d47f8b8dec4996a20fdee0ecd0e

commit_message:
devstack: set neutron_defaults

Current VIFHandler drivers require several options to be set in
kuryr.conf. This patch updates devstack plugin to configure those
options before running kuryr-kubernetes.

Change-Id: I223f17f98ffe10eb89a38995142c7b699ade2fba
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Controller side of pods' port/VIF binding

This patch introduces VIFHandler that is used by Kuryr-Kubernetes
controller to manage VIF annotation and related Neutron resources
which are used by CNI driver to enable pod networking.

Change-Id: I1acfa052a530f06def4f7179945fac1687e1951a
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

subject: Element overcloud-agent replaces os-collect-config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-14 03:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/overcloud-agent/README.md', 'elements/overcloud-agent/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-agent/install.d/10-enable-os-collect-config', 'elements/overcloud-agent/pkg-map', 'elements/overcloud-agent/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'Element overcloud-agent replaces os-collect-config

The element overcloud-agent is a purely package driven replacement for
the tripleo-image-elements element os-collect-config.

All it does is install the python-heat-agent package and enable the
os-collect-config service.

The intention is for this element to be merged unused, then a change
to the tripleo-common/image-yaml will confirm that it is working as
expected.

This is part of the effort to deprecate the entire
tripleo-image-elements repo.

Change-Id: I1f3bb386660f36813515544dc73b1c5e08467553
'}]
commit_message:
Element overcloud-agent replaces os-collect-config

The element overcloud-agent is a purely package driven replacement for
the tripleo-image-elements element os-collect-config.

All it does is install the python-heat-agent package and enable the
os-collect-config service.

The intention is for this element to be merged unused, then a change
to the tripleo-common/image-yaml will confirm that it is working as
expected.

This is part of the effort to deprecate the entire
tripleo-image-elements repo.

Change-Id: I1f3bb386660f36813515544dc73b1c5e08467553

subject: devstack: move to k8s 1.4.6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 14:20:09.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': 'devstack: move to k8s 1.4.6

In the patch I9abc0878612b97795c68c8d773e7a29e891d1a6f, I introduced
the configuration of CNI settings. However, that was not supported on
1.3.x, so a bump was necessary. This highlights the need for devstack
fullstack tests.

Change-Id: Id4391b6a13f330cf346bd9dc3de2b23ea4f9833c
Signed-off-by: Antoni S. Puimedon <asegurap@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: move to k8s 1.4.6

In the patch I9abc0878612b97795c68c8d773e7a29e891d1a6f, I introduced
the configuration of CNI settings. However, that was not supported on
1.3.x, so a bump was necessary. This highlights the need for devstack
fullstack tests.

Change-Id: Id4391b6a13f330cf346bd9dc3de2b23ea4f9833c
Signed-off-by: Antoni S. Puimedon <asegurap@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Resolve tasks by role tags

This commit switching tasks resolution approach to the tags based one.
Tag - minimal unit what's necessary only for task resolution and can be
mapped to the node through the role interface only. Each role provides set
of tags in its 'tags' field and may be modified via role API. Tag may be
created separately via tag API, but, this tag can not be used unless it's
stuck to the role.

Change-Id: Icd78fd124997c8aafb07964eeb8e0f7dbb1b1cd2
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
(cherry picked from commit 2b0242f64593be45e22f0f464bcbfe41492bb183)

In ResourceTracker, make sure to delete migration records for

commit_message:
Fixes for race conditions in revert migration with SR-IOV

Those races are intermittent and can be observed when stress testing
revert migration on instances with SR-IOV.

In ResourceTracker, make sure to delete migration records for
instances that we are migrating.

Change-Id: I08e5a4645690d77e8f2d786bcf63bfe5a8f4fa98

subject: custom interfaces can be used in node_templates
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-21 09:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['toscaparser/tests/data/custom_types/custom_interface.yaml', 'toscaparser/tests/data/test_custom_interface_invalid_operation.yaml', 'toscaparser/tests/data/test_custom_interface_in_template.yaml', 'toscaparser/elements/interfaces.py', 'toscaparser/tests/test_toscatplvalidation.py', 'toscaparser/tosca_template.py', 'toscaparser/nodetemplate.py'], 'message': 'custom interfaces can be used in node_templates

Standard and Configure interfaces was hardcoded and custom interfaces could not be used.

tosca_template.py: First the custom interface definitions are needed to be read
nodetemplate.py: During interface validation valid interface names should be
    collected from node_type definition
    and valid operation names should be collected from node_type
    and interface_type definitions.
elements/interfaces.py: in node_templates interface name-type resolution
    should be done based on node_type definition
    and interface definition can be collected either from loaded extension
    definitions (TOSCA_DEF) or loaded custom definitions (custom_def)

See added test cases for examples.

Change-Id: I6b324e3679b3a5d07b40a641b8c1e81983159b36
Closes-Bug: #1640098
'}]
commit_message:
custom interfaces can be used in node_templates

Standard and Configure interfaces was hardcoded and custom interfaces could not be used.

tosca_template.py: First the custom interface definitions are needed to be read
nodetemplate.py: During interface validation valid interface names should be
    collected from node_type definition
    and valid operation names should be collected from node_type
    and interface_type definitions.
elements/interfaces.py: in node_templates interface name-type resolution
    should be done based on node_type definition
    and interface definition can be collected either from loaded extension
    definitions (TOSCA_DEF) or loaded custom definitions (custom_def)

See added test cases for examples.

Change-Id: I6b324e3679b3a5d07b40a641b8c1e81983159b36
Closes-Bug: #1640098

commit_message:
Add user and project domains to ironic context

This change also removes most of the logic from ironic's
RequestContext to reuse the oslo_context as much as possible.
Usage of domain_id and domain_name in policy files is deprecated
and their support will be removed in the Pike release. domain_id
field was removed from the context class completely, domain_name
value now mathces the oslo_context expectations.

ContextHook is changed too so as not to duplicate from_environ
functional from oslo_context.

to_dict method left as is, so that we don't break an older service
receiving the context over RPC. It will be changed in Pike release
to reuse the base oslo_context class' to_dict.

Closes-Bug: #1602081
Closes-Bug: #1627173
Closes-Bug: #1641972
Co-Authored-By: Jamie Lennox <jamielennox@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9afe89bc6aee282ee4b7579d661e3fa83cc0ce84

subject: indexer: list_metric(), skip sql if names is empty
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-23 07:57:59.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'indexer: list_metric(), skip sql if names is empty

If list_metrics is called with an empty list this creates a
sql request can will not match anything. Sqlachemey is complaining
about this when we batch measure for resource without metrics.

SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "metric.name" was invoked with an empty
sequence. This results in a contradiction, which nonetheless can be
expensive to evaluate.  Consider alternative strategies for improved
performance. 'strategies for improved performance.' % expr)

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I9287c8d8ef1a5787f9245d78c197d870f959b0c6
'}]
commit_message:
indexer: list_metric(), skip sql if names is empty

If list_metrics is called with an empty list this creates a
sql request can will not match anything. Sqlachemey is complaining
about this when we batch measure for resource without metrics.

SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "metric.name" was invoked with an empty
sequence. This results in a contradiction, which nonetheless can be
expensive to evaluate.  Consider alternative strategies for improved
performance. 'strategies for improved performance.' % expr)

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I9287c8d8ef1a5787f9245d78c197d870f959b0c6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 10:56:24.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Correctly return exit code from stop

Panicking and returning non-success on stop often leads to resource
becoming unmanaged on that node.

Before we called get_status to verify that RabbitMQ is dead. But
sometimes it returns error even though RabbitMQ is not running. There
is no reason to call it - we will just verify that there is no beam
process running.

Closes-Bug: #1626933
Change-Id: Iaeebc4fe3d29d06f8f94dfbb676cd30cf090f415
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly return exit code from stop

Panicking and returning non-success on stop often leads to resource
becoming unmanaged on that node.

Before we called get_status to verify that RabbitMQ is dead. But
sometimes it returns error even though RabbitMQ is not running. There
is no reason to call it - we will just verify that there is no beam
process running.

Closes-Bug: #1626933
Change-Id: Iaeebc4fe3d29d06f8f94dfbb676cd30cf090f415

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 13:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: clean serial listen addr to always deal with string

When the MigrateData objects have been introduced the field
'serial_listen_addr' could not exist on compute nodes which have not
been upgraded so an utility method has been introduced to verify if
the field is set or return None. Now we should never be in the case
where the field is not set and we do not want to deal with cases where
that field could have been set to None or an empty string. This commit
clean the code to always use an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib3b2d96dc9063ad2e04bc9d70b3aa01de6db5158
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: clean serial listen addr to always deal with string

When the MigrateData objects have been introduced the field
'serial_listen_addr' could not exist on compute nodes which have not
been upgraded so an utility method has been introduced to verify if
the field is set or return None. Now we should never be in the case
where the field is not set and we do not want to deal with cases where
that field could have been set to None or an empty string. This commit
clean the code to always use an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib3b2d96dc9063ad2e04bc9d70b3aa01de6db5158

commit_message:

Devstack has removed KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND from it's
repo: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391380

Due to above change gate tests are failing, we should
remove it from trove plugin as well. Refer below for
it's deprecation and removal:-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086272.html

Closes-Bug: #1644085

commit_message:
Remove NotificationPayloadBase class

The NotificationPayloadBase class is not useful if we model the
notification payloads carefully. It will create another barrier for
understanding the notification code if used.

commit_message:
Remove the neutron-compute plane

With Contrail being used there are no neutron agents running on compute
nodes.  This commit removes the neutron compute related alarms and
Grafana dashboards.

commit_message:
Fixing endpoint type for glance client

Providing endpoint_type option to glance client.
Without that, public endpoint will be used to communicate
with glance.

Change-Id: I03e7ff07049158a8737fdf50d66c3cf7163d9f7c
Closes-bug: #1643903
(cherry picked from commit 76988e993c46f92906e35cf290251c5162907b67)

subject: Bump oslo.utils version to 3.17 in stable/newton
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 12:28:17.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump oslo.utils version to 3.17 in stable/newton

As of stable/newton Ironic is using oslo_utils.netutils.is_valid_mac
function that first appeared in oslo.utils 3.17 and is absent from
currently minimal required verison 3.16.

Such discrepancies are complicating packaging.

Change-Id: I538b9b22d549c5619dade5f7f9636492a9954ea6
'}]
commit_message:
Bump oslo.utils version to 3.17 in stable/newton

As of stable/newton Ironic is using oslo_utils.netutils.is_valid_mac
function that first appeared in oslo.utils 3.17 and is absent from
currently minimal required verison 3.16.

Such discrepancies are complicating packaging.

Change-Id: I538b9b22d549c5619dade5f7f9636492a9954ea6

subject: Add ceilometer-api-init-delete to run-upgrade.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 16:24:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Add ceilometer-api-init-delete to run-upgrade.sh

The ceilometer-api is removed as part of the
ceilometer-api-init-delete.yml playbook, in the upgrade-utilities, but
this was never added to the run-upgrade.sh script.

As a result the ceilometer-api is not removed correctly.

Change-Id: I816cb4dcdfa4f39b8dd911e640fb460c9592351f
Closes-Bug: #1642284
'}]
commit_message:
Add ceilometer-api-init-delete to run-upgrade.sh

The ceilometer-api is removed as part of the
ceilometer-api-init-delete.yml playbook, in the upgrade-utilities, but
this was never added to the run-upgrade.sh script.

As a result the ceilometer-api is not removed correctly.

Change-Id: I816cb4dcdfa4f39b8dd911e640fb460c9592351f
Closes-Bug: #1642284

commit_message:
Fix Designate source image container assets

When building Desginate from source, the require binaries were not
included, this commit addresses that issue by installing them
regardless of the build type.

Change-Id: I05d11ce8289a6f201311b556d2b43b373c90cd64
Closes-Bug: #1642995

commit_message:
Do not generate CephClusterFSID if already found

If the user provided a particular value for the CephClusterFSID,
we should not override it with the value autogenerated.

Change-Id: I19fc8974df233d809d4ab25f843fdb38789bfd72
Related-Bug: #1636555

Updating imports for agent metadata opts

dragon imports neutron/agent/metadata/config.
This conf option is being refactored and moved to
neutron/conf/agent/metadata/config. This patchset
updates import statements.

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

Change-Id: I572e9a41917c7f6f9fc64fc7ad3afcc1569f3d66
Closes-Bug: #1218185

subject: Move call trove cluster delete to check complete
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-21 09:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/trove/test_cluster.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/trove/cluster.py'], 'message': 'Move call trove cluster delete to check complete

There could be situation, when cluster cannot be available for
deleting, for example, it has BUILDING status. In such case delete
call will raise UnprocessableEntity exc. So, need to move cluster
delete to check_delete_complete and try to delete cluster.

Also, test successful cluster delete was fixed.

Change-Id: Ie05f33d6a3f653406d80a362066cac3ffec1e1ef
Closes-bug: #1597374
'}]
commit_message:
Move call trove cluster delete to check complete

There could be situation, when cluster cannot be available for
deleting, for example, it has BUILDING status. In such case delete
call will raise UnprocessableEntity exc. So, need to move cluster
delete to check_delete_complete and try to delete cluster.

Also, test successful cluster delete was fixed.

Change-Id: Ie05f33d6a3f653406d80a362066cac3ffec1e1ef
Closes-bug: #1597374

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-23 09:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/transport.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/utils.py', 'oslo_messaging/notify/_impl_routing.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/server/zmq_incoming_message.py', 'oslo_messaging/notify/middleware.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_message.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/server/zmq_ttl_cache.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia235afc3532f62f265f91ca46d2306c72fc2a2a2
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia235afc3532f62f265f91ca46d2306c72fc2a2a2

subject: Fix different zmq configurations for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 15:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Fix different zmq configurations for functional tests

Currently the driver name affects the choice of the test
configuration script being used. As it comes from test results
the same configuration runs for zeromq, zeromq-pub-sub, zeromq-proxy
so it doesn't make sense as we would like to test different zmq
configurations on that gates.

Change-Id: Ibb9cdbba4b896c17703b249eb07ec8f5be583a85
Depends-On: I94342be65564665faf27d8d01ae6650183146874
Related-Bug: #1643929
"}]
commit_message:
Fix different zmq configurations for functional tests

Currently the driver name affects the choice of the test
configuration script being used. As it comes from test results
the same configuration runs for zeromq, zeromq-pub-sub, zeromq-proxy
so it doesn't make sense as we would like to test different zmq
configurations on that gates.

Change-Id: Ibb9cdbba4b896c17703b249eb07ec8f5be583a85
Depends-On: I94342be65564665faf27d8d01ae6650183146874
Related-Bug: #1643929

subject: Run checklang on all branches
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-23 08:31:56.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Run checklang on all branches

The checklang job is named ubuntu-xenial and runs therefore due to the
global handling only on newton and newer. We need it running on all
branches. Add a branch condition that will catch all current and future
branches.

Change-Id: I237eebcc7d006b814f79edf6b3415e76902b49d1
'}]
commit_message:
Run checklang on all branches

The checklang job is named ubuntu-xenial and runs therefore due to the
global handling only on newton and newer. We need it running on all
branches. Add a branch condition that will catch all current and future
branches.

Change-Id: I237eebcc7d006b814f79edf6b3415e76902b49d1

subject: Fix Cinder's multibackend ZeroMQ job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 09:21:32.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Fix Cinder's multibackend ZeroMQ job

Turns out setting $DEVSTACK_GATE_ZMQ=1 isn't enough to configure ZeroMQ
for all the services. This patch fixes the job by enabling
devstack-plugin-zmq. This is the solution used in ZeroMQ tests for
oslo.messaging.

Change-Id: If7151f8e5e78921669d3a70f31ff6275ef42fe43
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Cinder's multibackend ZeroMQ job

Turns out setting $DEVSTACK_GATE_ZMQ=1 isn't enough to configure ZeroMQ
for all the services. This patch fixes the job by enabling
devstack-plugin-zmq. This is the solution used in ZeroMQ tests for
oslo.messaging.

Change-Id: If7151f8e5e78921669d3a70f31ff6275ef42fe43

subject: Make py file line endings unix style
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 10:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_sg_app.py'], 'message': "Make py file line endings unix style

The line endings were CRLF (dos/windows style). The standard is to use
UNIX style endings. No other change was made to the file. This is a
result of following command in dragonflow folder.

  find ./ -name '*.py' -type f -exec dos2unix {} \;

Change-Id: I30e14ce314981c10170a33aeee34412deeb29c6d
"}]
commit_message:
Make py file line endings unix style

The line endings were CRLF (dos/windows style). The standard is to use
UNIX style endings. No other change was made to the file. This is a
result of following command in dragonflow folder.

  find ./ -name '*.py' -type f -exec dos2unix {} \;

Change-Id: I30e14ce314981c10170a33aeee34412deeb29c6d

commit_message:
Move DVR fip agent gw port create out of transaction

This shouldn't be happening in a transaction. It creates
port resources in ML2 that need to have correct commit
semantics.

This refactors it to leverage the callback framework and
unifies the codepath for creating these DVR ports after
a router creation and after a router update with a migration.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: I15d8d32b54087e4a2ca1bfa74b46fa95adc4b95d

commit_message:
Enable TLS for keystone admin endpoint.

the keystone admin endpoint is listening on the external network;
This is because keystone v2.0 defaults to using the admin endpoint.
Given the fact that keystone handles very sensitive information, and
that we don't want credentials going over cleartext, TLS should be
enabled for it.

Change-Id: Ibe3f58fc0f71c09329e92cc9ded6c7b8e5dc0322

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 18:24:00.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fix ovs 2.4 to 2.5 upgrade - minor update non controllers

In I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae and
I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9 we landed a workaround
for the openvswitch 2.4 to 2.5 upgrade discussed in the bug below.

Unfortunately testing has revealed a problem with the minor update
case specifically for non controllers. It seems we would exit
before the ovs workaround has had a chance to execute. This moves
the block up a few lines to avoid this condition. As with the
other two reviews noted here, this will need to go into newton
and then mitaka too.

Change-Id: If905de82d96302334ebe02de9c43f00faed9b72b
Related-Bug: 1635205

commit_message:
Fix ovs 2.4 to 2.5 upgrade - minor update non controllers

In I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae and
I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9 we landed a workaround
for the openvswitch 2.4 to 2.5 upgrade discussed in the bug below.

Unfortunately testing has revealed a problem with the minor update
case specifically for non controllers. It seems we would exit
before the ovs workaround has had a chance to execute. This moves
the block up a few lines to avoid this condition. As with the
other two reviews noted here, this will need to go into newton
and then mitaka too.

Change-Id: If905de82d96302334ebe02de9c43f00faed9b72b
Related-Bug: 1635205

subject: only generate new release information, if there is a new release
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 15:53:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/new_release.py'], 'message': "only generate new release information, if there is a new release

When running new_release, I've found that it'll generate a new entry
with a new release number and the old sha if there are no intervening
changes. This proposed code will change that behavior and not generate
a new project deliverable file if there is no difference from the
previous one.

I find this useful when I run the new release command for multiple
projects and branches in that if there are no changes to tag, it
generates no output file.

I'm not positive that this change is all good; for example, I don't
know for sure that there are not situations where one would want to
tag a new release even if there are no changes.

Change-Id: I351ada42dde757f29094462b10011ec4f375d465
"}]
commit_message:
only generate new release information, if there is a new release

When running new_release, I've found that it'll generate a new entry
with a new release number and the old sha if there are no intervening
changes. This proposed code will change that behavior and not generate
a new project deliverable file if there is no difference from the
previous one.

I find this useful when I run the new release command for multiple
projects and branches in that if there are no changes to tag, it
generates no output file.

I'm not positive that this change is all good; for example, I don't
know for sure that there are not situations where one would want to
tag a new release even if there are no changes.

Change-Id: I351ada42dde757f29094462b10011ec4f375d465

The native interface chokes when doing db_add on an object that
was created within the same transaction due to the column we are

commit_message:
Handle db_add in transaction for new objects

The native interface chokes when doing db_add on an object that
was created within the same transaction due to the column we are
modifying not yet existing. This patch adds defaults for the
column.

Change-Id: I4386aa293f9b18d2e17b4a80d9c7da4b9b46f3c9
Closes-Bug: #1642764

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add gunicorn

Used by REST agent inside service VMs for the Octavia project
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386758/

* Is the library actively maintained?
Yes. https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/commits/master

* Is the library good code?
I believe so. Testing: https://travis-ci.org/benoitc/gunicorn

* Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?
Yes, gunicorn is licensed under the MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
Yes.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/gunicorn
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/python-gunicorn/

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
There is no other UWSGI runner included directly in g-r.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
Yes, it is required for the Octavia amphora-agent devstack deployment
that runs the octavia scenerio gate tests.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I211dc771aa95147c0f1d9e6ac1a65a7e164b33c2
'}]
commit_message:
Add gunicorn

Used by REST agent inside service VMs for the Octavia project
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386758/

* Is the library actively maintained?
Yes. https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/commits/master

* Is the library good code?
I believe so. Testing: https://travis-ci.org/benoitc/gunicorn

* Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?
Yes, gunicorn is licensed under the MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
Yes.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/gunicorn
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/python-gunicorn/

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
There is no other UWSGI runner included directly in g-r.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
Yes, it is required for the Octavia amphora-agent devstack deployment
that runs the octavia scenerio gate tests.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I211dc771aa95147c0f1d9e6ac1a65a7e164b33c2

commit_message:
Fix container port ipaddress setting in ipvlan/macvlan drivers

Currently ipaddress is being set from nova instance port and thus
making vm ip and container ip same. Fix this by using container port
dict for getting container IP.

Another change is renaming 'nested_port', which is actually Nova
instance port, to 'vm_port', for the sake of avoiding ambiguity.

Change-Id: I9ea93c88c2889c5a6b7eff230ffdfb87b96b0e25
Closes-bug: #1641537

Fullstack: Using the credentials from openrc config file

Add getting credentials from ENV, this requires us source
openrc file in our DevStack or production environment.
Also removing get_neutron_client_from_creds into fullstack
code, keeping or removing it should be discussed.

commit_message:
Fullstack: Catch neutron-client exception and cleanup resources

If we met neutron-client error, there are docker networks and
Neutron networks or ports in test environment.
We need to catch exception and delete those resources.

Change-Id: I3f2c3d873cff825dfecf43fffbb53d647cef674d
Closes-Bug: #1642978

commit_message:
Fixed vagrant provision script

Add sudo to command removing monasca-transform directory for renewal.
Without this it fails as the .git directories are permissioned elsehow
from the default user.

Change-Id: I4c9d3ff7ed1c2b841be82a66ec594033eec2af15

subject: Remove unique metric count aggregation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_transform/driver/mon_metrics_kafka.py'], 'message': 'Remove unique metric count aggregation

Removing unique metric count aggregation
since it causes data from Kafka to be pulled
and processed twice and leads to unecessary
increase in over all time required to process
a batch.

Change-Id: I2046f95709232979dfd590d5293c803cac05bbb2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unique metric count aggregation

Removing unique metric count aggregation
since it causes data from Kafka to be pulled
and processed twice and leads to unecessary
increase in over all time required to process
a batch.

Change-Id: I2046f95709232979dfd590d5293c803cac05bbb2

commit_message:
Make cloning of Grafana faster

The full history of Grafana is not required,
so clone only the $GRAFANA_BRANCH branch

Change-Id: I4838116379f85c31866be83484395d056e229c63

subject: Beautify, correct URLs in documentation files
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-18 04:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/vitrage-first_steps.rst', 'README.rst', 'doc/source/scenario-evaluator.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/notifier-aodh-plugin.rst', 'doc/source/nagios-config.rst', 'doc/source/zabbix_vitrage.rst', 'doc/source/add-new-datasource.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/alarm-severity-config.rst', 'doc/source/installation-and-configuration.rst', 'doc/source/resource-state-config.rst', 'doc/source/static-physical-config.rst', 'doc/source/nagios-devstack-installation.rst'], 'message': 'Beautify, correct URLs in documentation files

- Beautify, re-indent, format code in a lot of doc files
- Use relative URLs instead of absolute github URLs
- Some absolute github urls are not corrected yet:
    + URL for enabling vitrage in devstack
    + URL for enabling vitrage in horizon
- Update year number in doc/source/config.py from 2013 to 2016

My thought: We should have a blueprint
    to create more concise and easy to access like other project
    (nova: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/).
    Currently, that site for vitrage has not existed yet.

Notes: Change github URLs to relative URLs
    (or absolute URLs in docs.openstack.org/developers)
    will not work correctly
    if we do not have official documentation site.
    Hence, other people cannot follow the link to html page
    if they read vitrage documentation in github mirror.

Change-Id: Ifff8355c7e5291f68a7592d1617644053d790d5e
'}]
commit_message:
Beautify, correct URLs in documentation files

- Beautify, re-indent, format code in a lot of doc files
- Use relative URLs instead of absolute github URLs
- Some absolute github urls are not corrected yet:
    + URL for enabling vitrage in devstack
    + URL for enabling vitrage in horizon
- Update year number in doc/source/config.py from 2013 to 2016

My thought: We should have a blueprint
    to create more concise and easy to access like other project
    (nova: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/).
    Currently, that site for vitrage has not existed yet.

Notes: Change github URLs to relative URLs
    (or absolute URLs in docs.openstack.org/developers)
    will not work correctly
    if we do not have official documentation site.
    Hence, other people cannot follow the link to html page
    if they read vitrage documentation in github mirror.

Change-Id: Ifff8355c7e5291f68a7592d1617644053d790d5e

commit_message:
Revert "Disable cloud-init network auto configuration"

This fix doesn't fix the problem. I still see 50-cloud-init.cfg in /etc/network/interfaces.d/

This reverts commit faa9de1780f0c7e3a4202d67a11a83ea66a13803.

Change-Id: I93a7fa29ae932b0020a4dad17e580808ee3fb117

commit_message:
Introducing override for all resources in catalog

* override_resources type extended with additional parameter that allows
  to control whether create new resource if it is not in catalog
* override_resources is wrapped with create_resources
* user can put any resource definition in hiera to override its configuration

Change-Id: Ic1f7d856666eb84ced3cef986d8765edf707b481
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override
DocImpact
(cherry picked from commit fd7b99399b19e6ef0f5a68beb614a88ac702738c)

commit_message:
Add tempest plugins to ironic project

This adds the new ironic-tempest-plugin and
ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin repos to ironic governance, as the
beginning of the effort to split our tempest plugins to a separate repo.

Depends-On: I0fdb88d588608538720e4f3e1381930df8dd9a6f
Change-Id: I3e426c2f19eb00965eb7eb48b32f9b5e6c797307

commit_message:
Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:33:45.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/Puppetfile'], 'message': 'Update ref for puppet-neutron

Current keystone in Mitaka has case sensitive check
for domain_ids, and puppet-neutron module (tag 8.2.0)
configures domain_ids which are now incorrect from Keystone
point of view.
This commit updates ref of puppet-neutron module
in order to consume commit which contains proper settings
for domain ids and name.

Change-Id: I48426546d73d8c6b33f4e1c10e2e50fa5dc06765
Closes-Bug: #1643804
'}]
commit_message:
Update ref for puppet-neutron

Current keystone in Mitaka has case sensitive check
for domain_ids, and puppet-neutron module (tag 8.2.0)
configures domain_ids which are now incorrect from Keystone
point of view.
This commit updates ref of puppet-neutron module
in order to consume commit which contains proper settings
for domain ids and name.

Change-Id: I48426546d73d8c6b33f4e1c10e2e50fa5dc06765
Closes-Bug: #1643804

We have a number of projects whose unit tests don't entirely mock

Change-Id: Id2ec29f592896ca42a4e720af70d42a6f1eb2aa1

commit_message:
Acknowledge nominal prerequisites for tests

We have a number of projects whose unit tests don't entirely mock
out database or filesystem interactions, or need specific system
packages preinstalled. Be clear that the CTI doesn't forbid these
sorts of nominal deviations.

Change-Id: Id2ec29f592896ca42a4e720af70d42a6f1eb2aa1

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 20:35:07.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: If2cc9f72acbc444df107f95bded08a398a5d8be3
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: If2cc9f72acbc444df107f95bded08a398a5d8be3

subject: Remove conditional in keepalived profile
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 11:54:09.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/keepalived.pp'], 'message': "Remove conditional in keepalived profile

The point of these profiles is that we enable them by including (or not)
in tripleo-heat-templates.  Composability related features such as the
planned composable upgrades require this, so remove this conditional
that breaks the expected pattern.

In a future patch we should also remove the enable_loadbalancer boolean
but this maps to a heat parameter, so will require deprecation of the
parameter before we can fully remove it, and mostly this shouldn't
cause problems because both t-h-t and this profile default to true.

Closes-Bug: #1642936
Change-Id: Ia380890ae8a552164c4a3e58b1fc4c6eaa3431c4
Depends-On: I85a8b1cca7268506de22adfb3a8ce7faa4f157ef
"}]
commit_message:
Remove conditional in keepalived profile

The point of these profiles is that we enable them by including (or not)
in tripleo-heat-templates.  Composability related features such as the
planned composable upgrades require this, so remove this conditional
that breaks the expected pattern.

In a future patch we should also remove the enable_loadbalancer boolean
but this maps to a heat parameter, so will require deprecation of the
parameter before we can fully remove it, and mostly this shouldn't
cause problems because both t-h-t and this profile default to true.

Closes-Bug: #1642936
Change-Id: Ia380890ae8a552164c4a3e58b1fc4c6eaa3431c4
Depends-On: I85a8b1cca7268506de22adfb3a8ce7faa4f157ef

commit_message:
Update Python CTI for 3.5

The Mitaka and later releases are tested against a Python 3.5
interpreter instead of 3.4, so update the CTI accordingly.

Change-Id: I07aad53d78acf4c99d0eace49ab71445972f1c87

commit_message:
Support xenial in devstack install

Currently haproxy is only installed on trusty or precise because of
backports. It should be installed on xenial at least.

Change-Id: I4513ddd94d2a9f119c0f7db5c8997bb7276580a8
(cherry picked from commit 8418c8ad1ff3618cd7c1ac3c742a352e552aa30a)

subject: Default UpgradeLevelNovaCompute to "auto"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 12:43:30.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh', 'environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-init.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-converge.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-base.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker.yaml', 'overcloud.j2.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.j2.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': 'Default UpgradeLevelNovaCompute to "auto"

This means we don't have to do the dance with crudini to pin to
a specific version - since Liberty Nova has supported auto-detecting
the version via the "auto" setting:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/upgrade.html

This will also make converting to composable upgrades easier as
less special coordination of the nova services is required.

Related to blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service

Change-Id: Ibdd32d8cc99a283eb956f325fc125c14704cd9b5
'}]
commit_message:
Default UpgradeLevelNovaCompute to "auto"

This means we don't have to do the dance with crudini to pin to
a specific version - since Liberty Nova has supported auto-detecting
the version via the "auto" setting:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/upgrade.html

This will also make converting to composable upgrades easier as
less special coordination of the nova services is required.

Related to blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service

Change-Id: Ibdd32d8cc99a283eb956f325fc125c14704cd9b5

commit_message:
Update contributing doc

Rehoming code into neutron-lib isn't always a straight
forward process. This patch updates our contributing
and index doc source to include a high-level workflow
for such situations.

Change-Id: I9c678b4e3223c5c44b840029102e73ab5111e268

commit_message:
Python 2 and 3 Compatibility

We use six.assertCountEqual() beacause assertCountEqual() on Python 3
and assertItemsEqual() on Python 2. For more detail[1]
Otherwise, One path fix bug in ironic using six.assertCountEqual()[2]

[1]https://pythonhosted.org/six/#unittest-assertions
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167325/

Change-Id: I89fdf09ea7203cf0dc5691a52f217c51c38689a2

commit_message:
Port-to-VIF os-vif translator for hybrid OVS case

This patch introduces Port-to-VIF translation to 'os_vif_util' and
implements a translator that supports hybrid OpenVSwitch plugging
case.

commit_message:
mask private keys for the ssh power driver.

As this driver is deprecated masking here (opposed to strutils)
is simpler, and easier to backport. This can be removed along with
support for the ssh power driver.

Change-Id: I107f2ce4ee2cd22558455de7ed595c2b3a7c6845
Closes-Bug: #1638596

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-18 09:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Separate floating IP port creation from transaction

This moves the floating IP port creation outside of the transaction
that creates the floating IP record. This eliminates the use of one
of the GUARD_TRANSACTION flags to prepare us for the enginefacade
switch and correct event notification semantics for push
notifications.

Note that this introduces a small window where the server can die
mid-process and leave an orphaned port without a floating IP. This
is similar to what can happen for router gateway ports. The intention
is to address these in a follow-up patch with a periodic garbage
collection task that will look for floating IP ports with a device
ID of 'PENDING' since the tenant cannot delete them on their own.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: Ia4c34c6654a5bfb64fbf06b11b0a29b018c6854f
"}]
commit_message:
Separate floating IP port creation from transaction

This moves the floating IP port creation outside of the transaction
that creates the floating IP record. This eliminates the use of one
of the GUARD_TRANSACTION flags to prepare us for the enginefacade
switch and correct event notification semantics for push
notifications.

Note that this introduces a small window where the server can die
mid-process and leave an orphaned port without a floating IP. This
is similar to what can happen for router gateway ports. The intention
is to address these in a follow-up patch with a periodic garbage
collection task that will look for floating IP ports with a device
ID of 'PENDING' since the tenant cannot delete them on their own.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: Ia4c34c6654a5bfb64fbf06b11b0a29b018c6854f

subject: Add tox envs to help i18n in downstream plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-03 11:07:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/translation.rst', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add tox envs to help i18n in downstream plugins

When downstream want to use local translations, all they want to do is
update their .po files with their added strings and then add in their
matching translations. Because this is handled in zanata, there is no
straightforward way of doing this within Horizon currently, without
having some in depth knowledge of babel (or even knowing that we use
babel, which isnt standard in django). Previously this would have been
handled by manage.py makemessages, so this patch just adds some tox envs
for convenience.

A normal workflow for these envs would be:
1. Add new strings to horizon or some other downstream customisation
2. Use tox -e extractmessages to create the .pot file
3. Use tox -e update_catalog -- <locale> to update the .po files for
your chosen locale.

Closes-Bug: 1638672
Change-Id: I28b24df9504161fce977c84bb90fc5e7e484ad51
'}]
commit_message:
Add tox envs to help i18n in downstream plugins

When downstream want to use local translations, all they want to do is
update their .po files with their added strings and then add in their
matching translations. Because this is handled in zanata, there is no
straightforward way of doing this within Horizon currently, without
having some in depth knowledge of babel (or even knowing that we use
babel, which isnt standard in django). Previously this would have been
handled by manage.py makemessages, so this patch just adds some tox envs
for convenience.

A normal workflow for these envs would be:
1. Add new strings to horizon or some other downstream customisation
2. Use tox -e extractmessages to create the .pot file
3. Use tox -e update_catalog -- <locale> to update the .po files for
your chosen locale.

Closes-Bug: 1638672
Change-Id: I28b24df9504161fce977c84bb90fc5e7e484ad51

commit_message:
fixed cluster::mysql requires mysql client installed

cluster::mysql calls `mysql` command in create-init-file
However mysql client package is not installed at a moment,
when this command is executed. Thus it fails.

Change-Id: Iaf4dd8f8ffe58e47bef07df04952d889a8c32212
Closes-Bug: #1638904
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-29 13:19:04.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'OCF RA: Check partitions on non-master nodes

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server-release/pull/1

Partitions reported by `rabbit_node_monitor:partitions/0` are not
commutative (i.e. node1 can report itself as partitioned with node2, but
not vice versa).

Given that we now have strong notion of master in OCF script, we can
check for those fishy situations during master health check, and order
damaged nodes to restart.

Change-Id: I80a920725575c36d30726e519a95835fd5982ce0
Closes-Bug: 1628487
'}]
commit_message:
OCF RA: Check partitions on non-master nodes

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server-release/pull/1

Partitions reported by `rabbit_node_monitor:partitions/0` are not
commutative (i.e. node1 can report itself as partitioned with node2, but
not vice versa).

Given that we now have strong notion of master in OCF script, we can
check for those fishy situations during master health check, and order
damaged nodes to restart.

Change-Id: I80a920725575c36d30726e519a95835fd5982ce0
Closes-Bug: 1628487

commit_message:
Use system subunit command if python-subunit is installed globally

Sitepackage=True is specified for dsvm-fullstack in tox.ini.
And python-subunit is installed globally. In this case switch
to system subunit command.

commit_message:
Add index on instances table across project_id and updated_at

We should have an index on the instances.updated_at table because
that's what's used to filter instances when using the --changes-since
filter parameter with nova list.

Closes-Bug: #1642729

Change-Id: I4c723839f36efddd95cd24d745fb71c96c75d2c1

commit_message:
[Services] Introduce Identity Service

This patch introduces identity service. It is first step of unifying usage of
identity service and it bases on keystone wrapper.

Changes:
 - New service Identity is added with two version implementation(
   KeystoneServiceV2 and KeystoneServiceV3)
 - KeystoneWrapper is deprecated. It's impelemention is replaced by
   identity service
 - To reduce number of imports of eystoneclient around rally code,
   `_get_domain_id` method of KeystoneServiceV3 raises rally specific
   exception for 404 instead of keystone native exception
 - To avoid code duplication, `create_user` implementation of
   KeystoneServiceV3 starts using `list_roles` and `add_role` of Identity
   service instead of direct calls to keystoneclient.
 - Port several keystone scenarios related to roles to use IdentityService

TODO for further patches:
- move code from rally.plugins.openstack.scenarios.keystone.utils to Identity
  service
- add more support for Keystone V3

Change-Id: I266885d28232b02079968145063d88c675d02f11

Drop LBaaS v1 dashboard

There is no reason we have LBaaS v1 dashboard in Ocata or later.
